author: Special Correspondent
text:
Residents of Chennampatti in Anthiyur taluk submitted a petition to the district administration expressing disgust over non-construction of a motorable road to their village in Erode district on Monday. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Residents of Chennampatti in Anthiyur taluk on Monday threatened to return family and Aadhaar cards to the district administration to express disgust over absence of motorable road to their hamlet.

Children

A group of villagers, including several children, complained to the Collector that their repeated representations for the last six months for laying of a road had not been addressed.

The villagers said they would boycott the Assembly polls, if there is no action.
title: Villagers threaten to boycott poll
